activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 215, Branch 2

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Abitz

Cases 22CF68, 22TR548, 22TR549, & 22TR550 called @ 2:00 PM: Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Christopher A. Abitz. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding case status. Statement by DA Leusink regarding toxicology results and further scheduling. Atty Blankschein requests another STC. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared by Zoom for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Christopher A. Abitz. Atty Blankschein advises they are waiting on toxicology results. Court places case into suspended status to allow for lab results.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Christopher A. Abitz. Atty Blankschein requests another STC as parties await toxicology results.
Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:25 am.
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 09:25 am.

2:20 PM Defendant Christopher A. Abitz appeared in court with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Wesley Kottke for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:05 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 11:05 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case called @ 1:10 PM Defendant Christopher A. Abitz appeared, in custody, via video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant eligible for SPD serviced. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
